extension_description.message: FoxClocks shows times around the world at the bottom of your browser. It deals with daylight saving time so you don't have to.

time_zone_id.description: Title text when hovering over a location name in the Watchlist

n_tz_db_updated_message.message: Time zone database successfully updated to version $TZ_DB_VERSION$

o_extension_installed.message: Thanks for installing $EXTENSION_NAME$! For help, click here
o_extension_installed.description: Shown on the options screen when the extension is installed

o_extension_updated.message: $EXTENSION_NAME$ successfully updated! To see what's new, click here
o_extension_updated.description: Shown on the options screen when the extension is updated

o_zonepicker.description: The main tree on the left-hand side of the Options window

o_watchlist.description: The list of locations on the right-hand side of the Options Window. The name is actually a bit of a pun - it means both a list the user is watching, and a list of watches, i.e. small clocks. Probably doesn't translate

o_watchlist_name.description: Column header in the Watchlist. Short for 'Location name'

o_watchlist_time.description: Column header in the Watchlist. Current time

o_watchlist_name_placeholder.description: Text shown when there name of a location is empty

o_watchlist_time_format.description: Column header in the Watchlist. Allows the user to specify a custom format for each location

o_watchlist_time_format_placeholder.description: Text shown when the custom format for a location is empty (the usual case). The format of the clock will be the global format configurable in the Tools section

o_search_box_placeholder.description: The placeholder text for the search input in the options page

popup_search_box_placeholder.description: The placeholder text for the search input in the small popup window

o_tz_db_update_button.description: Button label to allow the user to manually check for a database update

o_tz_db_update_message_pending.description: Status text for the manual update check

o_tz_db_update_message_not_available.description: Status text for the manual update check

o_tz_db_update_message_success.description: Status text for the manual update check

o_time_format.description: Label for the dropdown of available pre-set time formats

o_standard_time_formats.message: h:mm a|h:mm a ddd|HH:mm:ss|h:mm dddd, MMM Do|h:mm dddd, Do MMM|h:mm a dddd, MMM Do, YYYY|h:mm a dddd, Do MMM, YYYY|HH:mm:ss, ddd, MM/DD/YY|HH:mm:ss, ddd, DD/MM/YY|HH:mm ddd MM/DD/YY|HH:mm ddd DD/MM/YY|h:mm:ssa, ddd MMM Do|h:mm:ssa, ddd Do MMM|ddd HH:mm
o_standard_time_formats.description: A list of standard time formats. This might not need translating - it's more a cultural issue; each token will appear in the current language. The various tokens are described below in time_format_token_xxx. The pipe character '|' separates formats. The first format will be default on install

o_custom_format_option.description: Custom time format option in the list of pre-set time formats

o_custom_format_placeholder.description: Text shown when no custom time format has been set in the cutom format box

time_format_token_YY_upper.description: Click on the help icon in the Tools section to see how this is displayed

time_format_literal_A_upper.description: An attempt to explain that time format containing the letter A will be converted to either AM or PM; a backslash before it will leave the A unconverted, i.e. literal

time_format_literal_word_label.description: Like time_format_literal_A_upper, but for multiple characters; 'has' will convert to 'hours-am/pm/seconds', but [has] will not be converted

time_format_literal_word_value.description: The example word used in time_format_literal_word_label
